excerpt: Admission is free to this beer museum in a former factory, with exhibits, tours & paid tastings.
detail_description: The Sapporo Beer Museum, located in a former factory, offers free admission and features exhibits, tours, and paid tastings. Visitors of all ages can enjoy a tour of the museum to learn about the history of beer in Japan and the beer-making process. The highlight of the tour is a half-hour tasting session with an array of beers available. While sake may seem like a more traditional Japanese drink, experiencing the birth of Hokkaido's famous beer at this museum is also worthwhile.
name: Sapporo Beer Museum
address: 9 Chome-1-1 Kita 7 Johigashi, Higashi Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 065-8633, Japan

detail_description: Odori Park, a spacious 1.5 km stretch located south of Sapporo Station, is more than just a park - it's a vibrant hub for events and leisure. Lined with trees and flowers that change with the seasons, the park hosts lively gatherings like the Yosakoi Soran Festival in summer and a charming winter festival illuminated by beautiful lights.
name: Odori Park
address: １〜１２丁目 Odorinishi, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 060-0042, Japan

excerpt: Built in 1878, this iconic wooden clock tower now houses a museum on the history of Sapporo.
detail_description: The Sapporo Clock Tower, also known as the Clock Tower, is a historic wooden building that has become an iconic sightseeing spot in Hokkaido. Originally completed in 1878 as the Former Sapporo Agricultural College Drill Hall, it now houses a museum showcasing the history of Sapporo. Designated as a National Important Cultural Property, this building has close ties to Hokkaido University and is used for academic events.
name: Sapporo Clock Tower
address: 2 Chome Kita 1 Jonishi, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 060-0001, Japan

excerpt: Famous TV tower built in the 1950s, with an observation deck offering panoramic views of the city.
detail_description: The Sapporo TV Tower, a famous landmark built in the 1950s, stands at 147.3 meters tall at the end of Odori Park in Sapporo City. Its observation deck, situated 90 meters above ground level, provides stunning panoramic views of the city and beyond. Visitors can enjoy iconic night views of Odori Park and experience thrilling transparent glass panels that slope down to their feet.
name: Sapporo TV Tower
address: 1 Chome Odorinishi, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 060-0042, Japan

excerpt: Family spot featuring samples & exhibits of chocolate & cookies, plus a train ride & garden area.
detail_description: Shiroi Koibito Park in Sapporo is a family-friendly destination that offers a variety of activities and attractions. Visitors can enjoy chocolate and cookie samples, explore exhibits showcasing the making of the famous Shiroi Koibito sweets, and even take a train ride through the park's garden area. The park also features a chocolate factory tour, cooking workshops, shops, cafes, and restaurants.
name: Shiroi Koibito Park
address: 2 Chome-11-36 Miyanosawa 2 Jo, Nishi Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 063-0052, Japan

excerpt: Innovative park designed by sculptor Isamu Noguchi, with a museum, wading pool & playgrounds.
detail_description: Nestled just 10 kilometers from downtown Sapporo, Moerenuma Park is a stunning testament to the vision of renowned sculptor Isamu Noguchi. This innovative park transforms a former landfill into an artistic haven, seamlessly blending nature and creativity. Visitors can wander through its expansive grounds, which feature geometric playgrounds, serene fountains, and even a man-made beach known as Moere Beach. The park's centerpiece is the striking Glass Pyramid that captures Noguchi's unique aesthetic.
name: Moerenuma Park
address: 1-1 Moerenumakoen, Higashi Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 007-0011, Japan

excerpt: Sapporo, capital of the mountainous northern Japanese island of Hokkaido, is famous for its beer, skiing and annual Sapporo Snow Festival featuring enormous ice sculptures. The Sapporo Beer Museum traces the city’s brewing history and has tastings and a beer garden. Ski hills and jumps from the 1972 Winter Olympics are scattered within the city limits, and Niseko, a renowned ski resort, is nearby.
detail_description: Sapporo, the capital of Hokkaido in Japan, is renowned for its beer, skiing, and the annual Sapporo Snow Festival showcasing massive ice sculptures. The city boasts the Sapporo Beer Museum which offers tastings and a beer garden. Additionally, remnants from the 1972 Winter Olympics can be found within the city limits. Nearby Niseko is a well-known ski resort.
name: Sapporo
address: Hokkaido, Japan

excerpt: Open-air museum of a 19th-century farming village featuring over 60 traditional wood & stone homes.
detail_description: Nestled just outside the bustling heart of Sapporo, the Historical Village of Hokkaido is a captivating open-air museum that transports visitors back to the 19th century. Spanning an impressive area equivalent to about 11.5 Tokyo Domes, this unique attraction features over 60 meticulously reconstructed traditional wood and stone homes, showcasing life during the Meiji and Taisho periods.
name: Historical Village of Hokkaido
address: Konopporo-50-1 Atsubetsucho, Atsubetsu Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 004-0006, Japan

detail_description: Sapporo is famous for hosting the Sapporo Snow Festival, a week-long event in February featuring stunning snow statues and ice sculptures at various locations in the city. One of the festival's attractions is Hitsujigaoka Observation Deck, where you can visit the Sapporo Hitsujigaoka & Dr Clark Museum for free. The museum showcases past posters and miniature replicas of snow sculptures from previous festivals, as well as exhibitions related to the Sapporo Olympics.
name: Sapporo Snow Festival Museum
address: 1 Hitsujigaoka, Toyohira Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 062-0045, Japan

excerpt: Landmark peak with a cable car to the summit, known for its nighttime panoramas over Sapporo.
detail_description: Mt. Moiwa is a renowned peak in Sapporo, offering breathtaking nighttime panoramas of the city and Ishikari Bay. Visitors can ascend to the summit via a cable car or the Mt. Moiwa sightseeing expressway, followed by a ride on the unique Morris Car. The mountain is popular among locals for its accessibility and features five lightly climbed trails ranging from 2.4km to 4.5km in length.
name: Mt. Moiwa
address: Moiwayama, Minami Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 005-0041, Japan

excerpt: Grand red-brick former government building from the 1880s, with exhibits on Hokkaido history.
detail_description: Hokkaidō Government Office, also known as the Former Government Office Building, is a striking red-brick structure dating back to the 1880s. This historical landmark boasts an American Neo-Baroque architectural style and has been designated as an Important Cultural Property of Japan. Inside, visitors can explore exhibits on Hokkaido's history and view the meticulously detailed Ezo Taigaizu map created by Matsuura Takeshiro.
name: Hokkaidō Prefectural Government Office
address: 6 Chome Kita 3 Jonishi, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 060-0003, Japan

excerpt: Traditional Shinto place of worship with a simple torii gate & stone statues of guard dogs.
detail_description: Hokkaido Shrine Tongu is a traditional Shinto place of worship located in the eastern island of Hokkaido. Established in 1869, it enshrines four deities and hosts the annual Sapporo Matsuri festival between June 14 and 16, featuring religious ceremonies and vibrant processions.
name: Hokkaido Shrine Tongu
address: 3 Chome-１０-10-26 Minami 2 Johigashi, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 060-0052, Japan

excerpt: City park with a symphony hall, literature museum, rental boats & landscape garden with a teahouse.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Sapporo, Hokkaido, Nakajima Park is a serene oasis that beckons visitors with its lush landscapes and tranquil waters. This expansive park features a symphony hall and a literature museum, making it an ideal spot for culture enthusiasts. Families can enjoy renting boats on the picturesque Iris Pond or simply stroll through the beautifully manicured gardens that include a charming teahouse.
name: Nakajima Park
address: 1 Nakajimakoen, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 064-0931, Japan

excerpt: Scenic, wooded park & national shrine site known for its 15-m. waterfall with viewing areas.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Sapporo, Maruyama Park is a picturesque haven that captivates visitors year-round. Spanning an impressive 68 hectares, this scenic park is adorned with approximately 1,700 wild cherry and maple trees that create a stunning display throughout the seasons.
name: Maruyama Park
address: ３ Miyagaoka, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 064-0959, Japan

excerpt: This fish market is known for its huge range of freshly caught raw produce & its dining stalls.
detail_description: Nijo Market is a must-visit in Sapporo, offering a wide variety of freshly caught seafood and produce. This 100-year-old market is within walking distance of major attractions and showcases Hokkaido's legendary seafood bounty. Visitors can enjoy kaisen-don (sashimi rice bowl) at dining stalls like Oiso, known for its delicious offerings.
name: Nijo Market
address: Japan, 〒060-0052 Hokkaido, Sapporo, Chuo Ward, Minami 2 Johigashi, 1 Chome, 南３条東１丁目〜２丁目

excerpt: Long-standing covered shopping street stretching for 7 blocks, with around 200 outlets.
detail_description: Tanukikoji Shopping Street, also known as Raccoon Alley, is a historic covered shopping street in Sapporo that spans 10 blocks and stretches for about 1 kilometer. With over 200 shops offering a diverse range of goods, from traditional kimonos and incense sticks to modern electronics, the arcade captures the lively atmosphere of a bustling bazaar.
name: Tanukikoji Shopping Street
address: 南2・3条西1～7丁目, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 060-0062, Japan

detail_description: Jozankei Onsen is a hot spring town located near Sapporo, about an hour's drive away. It's a great option for those looking for an alternative to the popular Niseko resorts or visitors with limited time in Sapporo. However, it can get crowded on weekends and holidays due to its convenient location.
name: Jozankei Onsen
address: Minami Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido, Japan

excerpt: Circa-1876 public university known for its leafy campus & degrees in science, engineering & IT.
detail_description: Hokkaido University, established around 1876, is a prestigious public university renowned for its expansive and verdant campus. Located in Sapporo, it offers a variety of degrees in fields such as science, engineering, and IT. For those eager to delve into the university's rich history and stunning surroundings, free walking tours are available from June to October.
name: Hokkaido University
address: 5 Chome Kita 8 Jonishi, Kita Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 060-0808, Japan

excerpt: Otaru, a port city on Hokkaido (Japan’s northernmost island), lies northwest of Sapporo on Ishikari Bay. The city is known for glassworks, music boxes and sake distilleries. Nishin Goten (“herring mansion”), a former fish processing plant built in 1897, explores the industry’s key role in the city’s earlier years. Completed in 1923, the Otaru Canal is now lined with cafes and shops in converted old warehouses.
detail_description: Otaru is a charming port city located on the Hokkaido island in Japan. It is renowned for its glassworks, music boxes, and sake distilleries. The Nishin Goten, a historic fish processing plant turned museum, showcases the city's earlier ties to the fishing industry. The Otaru Canal, completed in 1923, is now lined with cafes and shops housed in converted old warehouses.
name: Otaru
address: Hokkaido, Japan

excerpt: Elegant museum in a sculpture park, showing Sapporo & Hokkaido artists, plus global modern works.
detail_description: Sapporo Art Park is a delightful combination of art and nature, offering an outdoor gallery experience with approximately 73 large art pieces by local and international artists. The park's elegant museum showcases works by Sapporo and Hokkaido artists as well as global modern pieces. Additionally, visitors can enjoy sledding on snowy hills at the park or rent plastic sleds and doughnut-shaped tubes for a thrilling snow rafting experience pulled by a snowmobile.
name: Sapporo Art Park
address: 2 Chome-７５ Geijutsunomori, Minami Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 005-0864, Japan

excerpt: Ski jump area & former Winter Olympics site boasting scenic city views from the top.
detail_description: Nestled on the slopes of Mt. Okura, the Mt. Okura Ski Jump Stadium, also known as Ōkurayama-Schanze, is a remarkable site that once hosted the 1972 Winter Olympics. This iconic ski jump venue offers visitors an exhilarating experience with its impressive height of over 133 meters. A scenic chairlift ride whisks you to the top, where breathtaking panoramic views of Sapporo and its surrounding landscapes await.
name: Mt. Okura Ski Jump Stadium (Ōkurayama-Schanze)
address: 1274 Miyanomori, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 064-0958, Japan

excerpt: Family-friendly zoo offering up-close looks at polar bears, red pandas, penguins & reptiles.
detail_description: Sapporo City Maruyama Zoo is a top destination for animal lovers, offering an up-close experience with a variety of wildlife. As the tenth-largest zoo in Japan, it prides itself on providing naturalistic enclosures for its animals. Visitors can observe polar bears, red pandas, penguins, reptiles, and many other creatures in habitats that closely resemble their natural environments.
name: Sapporo City Maruyama Zoo
address: 3 Chome-1 Miyagaoka, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 064-0959, Japan

excerpt: Panoramic hilltop views in a pastoral setting with a statue of Dr. William S. Clark & grazing sheep.
detail_description: Located on the outskirts of Sapporo, Hitsujigaoka Observation Deck offers stunning panoramic views of the city and its surroundings. The observation hill is home to a statue of Dr. William S. Clark, an American professor who played a significant role in the establishment of Hokkaido University. Visitors can enjoy picturesque views that extend all the way to Mt. Shokanbetsu on clear days.
name: Sapporo Hitsujigaoka Observation Hill
address: 1 Hitsujigaoka, Toyohira Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 062-0045, Japan

excerpt: This cool, light-filled mall in a former beer factory features many retailers & dining options.
detail_description: Sapporo Factory is a large commercial complex situated on the grounds of the former Sapporo Beer Factory, which dates back to 1876. The complex comprises seven buildings, including original brick structures from the brewery's early days and a spacious atrium. Visitors can explore over 160 shops offering apparel, souvenirs, and locally made items. Additionally, there are various dining options, amusement facilities, fitness clubs, and even a hotel within the complex.
name: Sapporo Factory
address: 4 Chome Kita 2 Johigashi, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 060-0032, Japan

detail_description: Susukino St in Sapporo is a vibrant entertainment and nightlife district, offering a variety of experiences for visitors. It's known for its bustling atmosphere and diverse range of dining options, including the famous Ramen Yokocho serving authentic Sapporo ramen. While it has a lively nightlife scene, it also has historical significance as Sapporo's red-light district. The area offers an array of entertainment choices, making it an exciting destination to explore during your visit to Sapporo.
name: Susukino St
address: Minami 6 Jōnishi, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 064-0806, Japan

excerpt: This huge park is a popular place for year-round activities, such as biking, snow tubing & skiing.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Hokkaido, Takino Suzuran Hillside Park is a sprawling oasis that offers a plethora of year-round activities for outdoor enthusiasts. Just 18 kilometers south of Sapporo, this state-owned park is perfectly situated within a triangle connecting the city center, Chitose Airport, and Shikotsu Lake.
name: Takino Suzuran Hillside Park
address: 247 Takino, Minami Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 005-0862, Japan

excerpt: Expansive, contemporary railway & metro station connected to an array of shops & restaurants.
detail_description: Sapporo Station is a modern and extensive transportation hub that seamlessly connects to a variety of shops and dining options. It boasts an expansive underground shopping area offering a wide range of products including souvenirs, clothing, jewelry, cosmetics, and electronics. The station is also home to multi-story department stores like Daimaru and Esta, as well as smaller shopping areas such as Apia, Paseo East & West, and Stellar Place.
name: Sapporo Station
address: 4 Chome Kita 6 Jonishi, Kita Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 060-0806, Japan

detail_description: Moiwa Ropeway get in point is the starting point for an unforgettable journey up Mount Moiwa, a 531-meter-high mountain located in central Sapporo. Visitors can take a Swiss-made mini cable car to reach the peak and enjoy a 360-degree panoramic view of Ishikari Plain, Ishikari Bay, and Mashike Mt.Shokanbetu without any obstructions.
name: Mount Moiwa Ropeway Entrance
address: 5 Chome-3-7 Fushimi, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 064-0942, Japan

excerpt: Ski-resort complex featuring Olympic-level ski slopes & snowboarding, plus a seasonal golf course.
detail_description: Nestled just 40 minutes from the heart of Sapporo, Sapporo Teine Ski Center is a fantastic destination for winter sports enthusiasts and families alike. This ski resort boasts Olympic-level slopes and a variety of terrains across its two main areas: the Highland Zone and the Olympia Zone. The Olympia Zone caters to beginners with its gentle, wide courses, making it an ideal spot for families looking to introduce their kids to skiing or snowboarding.
name: Teine Highland Ski Center Sapporo
address: 172 Teinekanayama, Teine Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 006-0049, Japan

excerpt: Built in 1869, this nature-rich Shinto shrine honors 4 deities, including the Emperor Meiji.
detail_description: Hokkaido Jingu, a Shinto shrine built in 1869, is located in Sapporo and is dedicated to four deities, including Emperor Meiji. It was established around 150 years ago and is considered the most important shrine in the city. The shrine honors three gods, with locals often seen making offerings to them. This relatively youthful shrine stands out amidst Japan's famous shrines and holds historical significance as it guards the pioneering career of Hokkaido.
name: Hokkaido Jingu
address: 474 Miyagaoka, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 064-0959, Japan

excerpt: This nature park has sweeping views of Sapporo, plus a plaza with a water fountain & restrooms.
detail_description: Asahiyama Memorial Park, opened in 1970 to commemorate Sapporo's centennial, offers a vast panorama of the cityscape from an elevation of over 130 meters. The park provides sweeping views of Sapporo and serves as a quick escape from the city's hustle and bustle without leaving its limits. It is known for its beautiful nature, water fountain plaza, restrooms, and connecting trail to Mt Moiwa for hiking enthusiasts.
name: Asahiyama Memorial Park
address: 4 Chome-1-3 Sakaigawa, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 064-0943, Japan

excerpt: 19th-century university botanical gardens with a tropical greenhouse & a large collection of plants.
detail_description: The Botanic Garden Hokkaidō University, established in 1886, is a historic botanical garden located at the heart of Sapporo. Originally created for educational purposes, it now offers visitors beautifully maintained gardens with diverse plant species and a tropical greenhouse. The garden's lush greenery, colorful flowers, and serene walkways make it an ideal place to unwind and appreciate nature. In autumn, the vibrant fall foliage adds to the garden's charm.
name: Botanic Garden Hokkaidō University
address: Japan, 〒060-0003 Hokkaido, Sapporo, Chuo Ward, 北３条西８丁目

excerpt: Modern art musuem featuring a collection of paintings & glassworks, plus special exhibitions.
detail_description: The Hokkaido Museum of Modern Art in Sapporo is a serene and immersive escape, especially on rainy or snowy days. With around 5,400 pieces, the museum offers a diverse collection of local and contemporary art, showcasing the art scene and culture in Sapporo and beyond. The museum's themes include Jules Pascin and the Ecole de Paris, Hokkaido-associated art, glassware from different periods, modern Japanese art, and contemporary Japanese art.
name: Hokkaido Museum of Modern Art
address: 17 Chome Kita 1 Jonishi, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 060-0001, Japan

detail_description: Experience the breathtaking sunset or night view of Sapporo at the Mount Moiwa Observation Deck, located on a 531-meter mountain south of downtown Sapporo. Accessible by ropeway and cable car, this popular spot offers panoramic views of Sapporo, Ishikari Plain, and Ishikari Bay. The night view from this altitude is truly unforgettable and has been recognized as one of Japan's top three city night views.
name: Mount Moiwa Observation Deck
address: Moiwa Sancho Station, 1 Moiwayama, Minami Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 005-0041, Japan

excerpt: Modern museum with exhibits on local history, nature & Ainu culture, with multilingual audio guides
detail_description: Hokkaido Museum is a modern museum in Sapporo that offers exhibits on local history, nature, and Ainu culture. Visitors can enjoy multilingual audio guides as they explore the museum's diverse offerings. Additionally, sports enthusiasts may want to visit the Sapporo Dome, home to the Hokkaido Nippon-Ham Fighters baseball team and Hokkaido Consadole Sapporo football club.
name: Hokkaido Museum
address: Konopporo-53-2 Atsubetsucho, Atsubetsu Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 004-0006, Japan

excerpt: Opened in 2003, the 173-m high skyscraper houses a shopping mall, office complex & observation deck.
detail_description: The JR Tower is a prominent 173-meter high skyscraper that opened in 2003. It is directly connected to Sapporo Station, serving as a gateway to various transportation options within the city. The tower features a diverse range of amenities, including a shopping mall, office complex, movie theater, and hotel. Visitors can enjoy panoramic views from the observatory on the 38th floor.
name: JR Tower
address: 2 Chome Kita 5 Jonishi, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 060-0005, Japan

detail_description: Hokkaido Shrine Mikado, situated in the Chuo District of Sapporo City, is a significant religious site with a rich history dating back to 1869. Initially established as a place of faith for pioneers by Emperor Meiji, it enshrines the Kaitaku Sanshin (Developing Three Deities). The shrine boasts beautiful gardens and is surrounded by parks, offering a peaceful and serene atmosphere.
name: Hokkaido Shrine Mikado
address: 474 Miyagaoka, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 064-0959, Japan

detail_description: Sapporo Shiryokan, formerly known as Sapporo Court of Appeal, has been a significant cultural property since 2018. Built in 1926, it was repurposed into a resource center after the court's relocation in 1973. Today, it houses the SIAF lounge and Criminal Court Exhibition Room, offering historical documents and reenactments of the court's era.
name: Sapporo Shiryokan (Former Sapporo Court of Appeal)
address: 13 Chome Odorinishi, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 060-0042, Japan

detail_description: Shiroi Koibito Factory is a must-visit destination in Hokkaido, known for its signature white chocolate treat. The facility offers guided tours where visitors can witness the chocolate-making process and explore the grounds. Additionally, there's a charming cafe serving delightful soft serve ice cream and a souvenir shop with tempting treats to take home.
name: ISHIYA CO., LTD. Miyanosawa Factory
address: 2 Chome-11-36 Miyanosawa 2 Jo, Nishi Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 063-0052, Japan

detail_description: Susukino, located in Hokkaido, is renowned as the largest red light district in the region and is one of Japan's three major districts of its kind. It boasts a plethora of bars, restaurants, hotels, and entertainment venues. Visitors can immerse themselves in the vibrant atmosphere illuminated by neon lights and experience the local drinking culture.
name: Susukino
address: 4-chōme Minami 4 Jōnishi, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 064-0804, Japan

detail_description: Ramen Alley, located in Sapporo on the island of Hokkaido, is a must-visit for ramen enthusiasts. This area offers a unique twist on traditional Japanese ramen, particularly with its specialty miso ramen. Even Anthony Bourdain was drawn to this culinary hotspot and savored the distinct flavors that set it apart from other regions in Japan.
name: Ramen Alley
address: 3 Chome-10 Minami 5 Jonishi, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 064-0805, Japan

excerpt: Skiing & snowboarding offered in a standard setup with a ski lift, restaurants & sports shop.
detail_description: Nestled just outside of Sapporo, the Sapporo Kokusai Ski Resort is a winter wonderland that beckons both locals and visitors alike. Known for its exceptional powdery snow, this resort may not boast the vastness of some larger ski areas, but it compensates with quality amenities and a cozy atmosphere. With five lifts servicing seven well-groomed courses, it's an ideal destination for beginners and intermediate skiers looking to hone their skills.
name: Sapporo Kokusai Ski Resort
address: Japan, 〒061-2301 Hokkaido, Sapporo, Minami Ward, Jōzankei, 937番地先

excerpt: Popular retailers & restaurants line this subterranean tunnel between subway stations.
detail_description: Sapporo Underground Shopping Malls Aurora Town, also known as Paul Town, is a bustling subterranean tunnel filled with popular retailers and restaurants. This underground street is a popular means of movement for Sapporo citizens, especially during heavy snowfall. The malls frequently hold sales and events, offering great items at affordable prices.
name: Sapporo Underground Shopping Malls Aurora Town
address: Odorinishi, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 060-0042, Japan

excerpt: Known for its depth & clarity, this lake in a volcanic crater offers boating, fishing & sightseeing.
detail_description: Lake Shikotsu, located in a volcanic crater, is renowned for its remarkable depth and crystal-clear waters. Visitors can enjoy various activities such as boating, fishing, and sightseeing around the lake. The area also offers a diverse itinerary including stops at Nakayama Pass Rest, Silo Observatory, Lake Toya Onsen Town for lunch and sightseeing, Showa Shinzan Bear Ranch, Noboribetsu Jigokudani, and Mitsui Outlet Park.
name: Lake Shikotsu
address: Chitose, Hokkaido, Japan

excerpt: Draft beers & meaty all-you-can-eat barbecues at huge contemporary spaces in a former factory.
detail_description: Sapporo Beer Garden is a must-visit destination for beer and barbecue enthusiasts. Located in a former factory, it offers contemporary spaces for enjoying draft beers and all-you-can-eat barbecues. The cluster of restaurants within the garden includes atmospheric European beer halls and the more refined Garden Grill restaurant. Visitors can savor Sapporo's iconic dish jingisukan, featuring tender lamb meat and seasonal vegetables cooked on a special metal dome-skillet.
name: Sapporo Beer Garden
address: 9 Chome-2-10 Kita 7 Johigashi, Higashi Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 065-0007, Japan

excerpt: Museum with historical exhibits on the Winter Olympic Games, plus ski jump & bobsled simulations.
detail_description: The Sapporo Olympic Museum is a dedicated space showcasing the history and events of the 1972 Winter Olympics held in Sapporo. Visitors can engage in simulations like ski jumping and speed skating while being close to the Okurayama Ski Stadium, where some of the 1972 Winter Olympics events took place. The museum features an extensive collection of winter sports-related exhibits and offers insights into the history of the Winter Olympic Games.
name: Sapporo Olympic Museum
address: 1274 Miyanomori, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 064-0958, Japan

excerpt: Popular promenade along the Sousei River with greenery, artwork & steps down to the water.
detail_description: Sōseigawa Park, completed in 2011, is a popular promenade along the Sousei River in central Sapporo. The 820-meter-long park features greenery, artwork installations, and steps leading down to the water. It was designed to evoke the atmosphere of earlier times when the riverfront was bustling with activity.
name: Sōseigawa park
address: 1 Chome Minami 3 Johigashi, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 060-0053, Japan

detail_description: Nestled at the foot of Mount Moiwa, the Sapporo Waterworks Memorial Museum is a beloved destination for both locals and visitors. The museum offers an engaging space for leisure, education, and play centered around water. Families with young children will appreciate amenities such as a nursing room and a dedicated play area. During the summer months, visitors can also enjoy an outdoor splash pad. However, it's important to note that the museum is closed from mid-November to mid-April.
name: Sapporo Waterworks Memorial Museum
address: 4 Chome-6-17 Fushimi, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 064-0942, Japan

detail_description: Hill of the Buddha, situated in Makomanai Takino Cemetery in southern Sapporo, is a stunning attraction featuring a massive statue of the Buddha emerging from the hillside. Designed by renowned architect Tadao Ando, this unique site offers peaceful gardens and scenic landscapes that exude tranquility and spirituality. During July, visitors can witness the breathtaking sight of purple lavender covering the surrounding grounds. The dome surrounding the statue showcases majestic vibes while maintaining simplicity and humility.
name: Hill of the Buddha
address: 2 Takino, Minami Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 005-0862, Japan

detail_description: Sapporo Central Wholesale Market is not open to the general public for shopping, but visitors can arrange Japanese language tours between 5:00 and 16:00. It's best to visit in the early morning to witness the lively seafood and fruit/vegetable auctions. The market offers a wide variety of ocean produce, including live crabs, sea urchin, salmon roe, sweet scallops, shrimp, abalone, and fresh fish like salmon and mackerel.
name: Sapporo Central Wholesale Market
address: 20 Chome-2-1 Kita 12 Jonishi, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 060-0012, Japan
